result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Konwent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended Fine Due ($10 drgod plus $15.65 10% restitution surcharge.)
$625.11 due in 30 days or 7 days KCJ or 7 days Work Crew Consecutive to mandatory time.
$443.00 due in 30 days or 7 days KCJ or 7 days Work Crew Consecutive to Mandatory time.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty James Allen.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 1yr KCJ commencing forthwith.  Credit for 34 days.  Huber allowed for work (if working) & childcare.  Deft may serve his time in the Racine Co Jail if approved by both sheriffs.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $156.46.  Bond to apply.  Costs ordered.  Balance of bond to be applied.  Balance due in 30 days.  In default, 7 days work crew or 7 days KCJ consec to mandatory time.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.
of Deft to Modify Cash Bail

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty James Allen appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Atty James Allen recently appointed; defense counsel provided with documentation of the deft's Illinois convictions.  Sentencing set for 6/8/16 @ 11am
Atty James Allen

943.50(1m)(b) Misd Retail Theft - Int Take Repeater

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft now wishes to have counsel.  Sentencing/status set for 5/25/16 @ 2pm.  Court amends deft's bond to $5,000 cash with the same conditions.  Deft taken into custody.
Clerk Lehman spoke w/Agent Payne (Illinois agent) - agent reports the deft is living at 13811 S Western, Blue Island, IL 60406.
Copies of complaints/indictments from deft's Illinois cases; copy sent to deft & DA's office

For Restitution Order

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $156.46.  Sentencing set over to 5/5/16 @ 3pm.  Court requests the clerk contact DuPage County to see if a copy of the indictment can be obtained.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
